text: I think the main thing that really
excites G about using AWS is being able
to provide very rich synchronous Global
gameplay experiences for our players and
being able to offer those Services cost
competitively and in a manner that
allows us to be very flexible my name is
Nick dor I'm senior director of
Technology at gree our products are
free-to-play mobile games for both IOS
and Android we make a modern war Kingdom
age Crime City War of Nations Knights
and Dragons and uh it's really our
mission to create enduring social
entertainment for our customers with AWS
we're able to provide that uh better
than we would have been able to provide
it in our own data centers I think the
main thing we saw is the ability to
rapidly change our infrastructure based
on our needs when we ran our games in
our own data centers we had to provision
for Peak capacity so we had to have more
infrastructure available to handle those
spikes and traffic with AWS we're able
to automatically scale up for these
events and then scale down when the
events are over to get back down a
Baseline and from a cost control
perspective we're able to just pay for
what we need and it's actually lower
cost for us overall we're provisioning
servers in less than 45 seconds and this
is compared to a few hours or even
several days with with our traditional
uh data center providers we process
about 500 GB of logs game event logs per
day and those are used for understanding
our player base what's working in the
games what's not working we want to be
able to provide our players with more

battles or collaborative play uh with

use uh elb elasticache RDS Dynamo red

support organization building out our
